title: 114_hr5770
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016" establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans. This plan covers enrolled veterans and their families, providing dental insurance for their dental care needs. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. Covered individuals include enrolled veterans and their families eligible for medical care. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the plan, providing benefits for dental care and treatment. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the voluntary dental insurance plan, providing various benefits including diagnostic, preventative, restorative, surgical, and emergency services for enrolled individuals for a minimum prescribed period. Enrollment in the dental insurance plan is voluntary for a minimum prescribed period. Premiums for coverage will be set by the Secretary to cover all associated costs and will be adjusted annually. The Secretary adjusts annual premiums for dental insurance coverage. Individuals must pay the full premium and copayments. Voluntary disenrollment is permitted. The Secretary allows voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan within 30 days of enrollment, with specific circumstances prescribed by the Secretary to prevent jeopardizing the plan. The Secretary permits voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan under specific circumstances to prevent jeopardizing the plan, such as relocation outside the plan's jurisdiction. The Secretary allows voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan in certain situations, such as relocation outside the plan's jurisdiction or due to a serious medical condition. Procedures will be established for timely determinations on the permissibility of disenrollments. The Secretary will establish procedures for determining the permissibility of voluntary disenrollments from the dental insurance plan. Participation in the plan will not affect entitlement to outpatient dental services provided by the Secretary under section 1712. The dental insurance plan under section 1712 will not affect entitlement to outpatient dental services. The plan will be administered according to regulations set by the Secretary and will terminate on December 31, 2021. A clerical amendment will be made to the table of sections in chapter 17. Repeal of Section 510 of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010, which pertains to a dental insurance plan for veterans and survivors and dependents of veterans. This includes a clerical amendment to the table of contents.
